greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle of rooted identity trees with n nodes and k leaves.
link: Andrew Howroyd, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1226 (first 70 rows)
Index entries for sequences related to rooted trees
formula: G.f. satisfies A(x,y) = x*y + x*WEIGH(A(x,y)) - x. Shifts up under WEIGH transform.
example: The identity trees with n=6 nodes, as (preorder-) level sequences, together with their number of leaves, and an ASCII rendering, are:
This gives [1, 4, 1], row n=6 of the triangle.
program: WeighMT(u)={my(n=#u, p=x*Ser(u), vars=variables(p)); Vec(exp( sum(i=1, n, (-1)^(i-1)*substvec(p + O(x*x^(n\i)), vars, apply(v->v^i,vars))/i ))-1)}
A(n)={my(v=[y]); for(n=2, n, v=concat([y], WeighMT(v))); apply(p->Vecrev(p/y), v)}
results.author: _Christian G. Bower_, May 12 2000
